name: Chicken in a Crockpot
ingredients: 1 whole chicken, about 4 1/2 pounds (or size that fits your slow cooker)

instructions.en: Place the chicken in the crock pot; sprinkle desired seasonings inside the cavity and all over the outside. Use plenty of salt to avoid bland taste.
Turn breast side up in the slow cooker; add no liquid.
Cover and cook on LOW for 5-6 hours (or up to 10 hours if needed, but chicken will be very well done).
Carefully remove the chicken from the cooker to a large plate or container.
Cut into serving size pieces, or pull the meat off the bones for use in other recipes.

notes: One 4 1/2 pound chicken will yield about 4 cups diced chicken. Can be frozen in 2-cup containers for later use.

variations.name: Chicken Breasts in a Crock Pot
ingredients: Split chicken breasts with skin and bones
instructions: Season the chicken breasts and place in the slow cooker; add no liquid.
Cover and cook on LOW for 5 hours.
Remove chicken pieces and allow to cool before deboning.
Cut up the meat for immediate use or freeze for later.
variations.notes: 9 chicken breasts yield about 8 cups cubed chicken. After 5 hours, the chicken should be perfectly done, tender, and juicy.

additionalRecipes.name: Crock Pot Chicken Broth
instructions: Put all the bones back in the slow cooker with any remaining cooking liquid.
Add 6-8 cups cold water and a bit more seasoning.
Cook on HIGH for about 3 hours.
Strain out the bones and let the broth chill overnight.
Once cold, skim off any fat from the top.
Divide broth into individual containers and freeze for later use.
additionalRecipes.notes: Can be divided into 1 and 2 cup containers. Label and date containers before freezing.
